newsitem.title: ESTONIA: NRG Energy and Estonia approve joint venture.
newsitem.headline: NRG Energy and Estonia approve joint venture.

text.p: Estonia on Tuesday approved an agreement with U.S. NRG Energy to form a joint venture that may bring some $250 million of investment to the Baltic state's power generation system, NRG said in a statement.
"The parameters of the business plan as well as deadlines for the feasibility study have been established now," NRG spokesman Gary Boline said in a statement.
NRG Energy, wholly-owned subsidiary of the American Northern States Power group, says the money will be used to restore two Estonian power plants.
This would be one of the largest foreign investments in Estonia.
The two companies will sign the agreement soon with a feasibility study and business plan to be devised in the next six months.
"We are convinced that the preparation of the business plan will proceed as intended and it will be approved by both parties before next summer," Boline said.
A memorandum of understanding was signed in March 1996 by Essti Energia and NRG in Washington.
